results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = (2^k-1)*binomial(n-1,k-1) (1<=k<=n).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
maple: T:=(n,k)->(2^k-1)*binomial(n-1,k-1): for n from 1 to 11 do seq(T(n,k),k=1..n) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
program: (PARI) for(n=1,12, for(k=1,n, print1((2^k -1)*binomial(n-1,k-1), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Jun 08 2017
(MAGMA) [(2^k -1)*Binomial(n-1,k-1): k in [1..n], n in [1..12]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 19 2019
(Sage) [[(2^k -1)*binomial(n-1,k-1) for k in (1..n)] for n in (1..12)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 19 2019
(GAP) Flat(List([1..12], n-> List([1..n], k-> (2^k -1)*Binomial(n-1,k-1) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 19 2019
